conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, analyze their motion using the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity of particles A and B as a function of time.
Particle A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2v0 at t0, then decreases linearly back to 0 at 3t0.
Particle B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to v0 at 2t0, remains constant until 4t0, and then decreases linearly back to 0 at 6t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle A from 0 to t0: Area under the graph (triangle) = 1/2 * t0 * 2v0 = v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle A from t0 to 3t0: Area under the graph (triangle) = 1/2 * 2t0 * 2v0 = 2v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by A from 0 to 3t0: v0 t0 + 2v0 t0 = 3v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 0 to 2t0: Area under the graph (triangle) = 1/2 * 2t0 * v0 = v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 2t0 to 4t0: Area under the graph (rectangle) = 2t0 * v0 = 2v0 t0.
Calculate distance traveled by Particle B from 4t0 to 6t0: Area under the graph (triangle) = 1/2 * 2t0 * v0 = v0 t0.
Total distance traveled by B from 0 to 6t0: v0 t0 + 2v0 t0 + v0 t0 = 4v0 t0.
Determine when A and B meet: A travels 3v0 t0 by 3t0, B travels 3v0 t0 by 4t0, so they meet at 4t0.
Particles A and B meet at t = 4t0.
